snippet: Nate McLouth nearly tied the game in the sixth inning, crushing a fastball to right field that was ruled foul but that stirred much debate.
abstract: Baltimore Orioles missed chances in Game 5 division series loss to New York Yankees, including Orioles outfielder Nate McLouth's sixth-inning hit to right field that was ruled foul, stirring much debate.
lead_paragraph: Nate McLouth nearly tied the game in the sixth inning, crushing a fastball to right field that was ruled foul but that stirred much debate.

headline.seo: Orioles Miss Out on Close Foul Ball Call Against Yankees
headline.main: Orioles Miss Their Chances, Including Close Call in Sixth
headline.print_headline: Orioles Miss Their Chances, Including Close Call in Sixth
